result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J. Martz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: - Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked, the Probation Officer shall notify the Clerk of Court in writing of any unpaid restitution which shall be reduced to a civil judgment and docketed in the office of the Clerk of Circuit Court for Adams County, Wisconsin.

All unpaid Court ordered financial obligations shall convert to civil judgment upon revocation or discharge from probation and Probation Agent shall advise the court of amounts due and owing prior to revocation or discharge.
Defendant shall be gainfully employed,seek employment or continue his/her education for the purpose of future employment.
Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Probation Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants or, unless modified by Probation Agent, shall not enter upon the premises of any business serving intoxicating beverages except as necessary for employment purposes.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with co-defedants: Jacob Hardman, Bryan Devore, Nicholas Rivera, Thomas Fraley
Defendant shall have no contact with victims: Donna Huerta/Donna's Slip Inn or James Bean/Wood Lake Resort.

If defendant has not already done so, he/she shall provide a biological specimen to the State Crime Laboratory for deoxyribonucleic acid analysis (DNA testing) pursuant to Section 973.047(1f) Wis. Stats.  
Defendant shall, upon request, submit to random testing for drug or alcohol abuse.
